item.title: Easy Elevation for `rayshader` with `elevatr`
item.description: library(rayshader) ## Warning in rgl.init(initValue, onlyNULL): RGL: unable to open X11 display ## Warning: 'rgl_init' failed, running with rgl.useNULL = TRUE library(elevatr) library(raster) ## Loading required package: sp data(lake) lake_b <- rgeos::gBuffer(lake, width = 1000) lake_dem <- get_elev_raster(lake_b, z=12, clip = "bbox") ## Merging DEMs ## Clipping DEM to bbox ## Reprojecting DEM to original projection ## Note: Elevation units are in meters. ## Note: The coordinate reference system is: ## +proj=aea +lat_1=20 +lat_2=60 +lat_0=40 +lon_0=-96 +x_0=0 +y_0=0 +datum=NAD83 +units=m +no_defs +ellps=GRS80 +towgs84=0,0,0 lake_dem_m <- matrix(extract(lake_dem,raster::extent(lake_dem)), nrow=ncol(lake_dem),ncol=nrow(lake_dem)) lake_water <- detect_water(lake_dem_m) lake_ray_shade <- ray_shade(lake_dem_m,zscale=50,lambert=FALSE) lake_ambient_shade <- ambient_shade(lake_dem_m,zscale=50) lake_dem_m %>% sphere_shade(texture = "desert") %>% add_water(lake_water, color="desert") %>% add_shadow(lake_ray_shade) %>% add_shadow(lake_ambient_shade) %>% plot_3d(lake_dem_m,zscale=10,fov=0,theta=135,zoom=0.

item.title: Download Shapefiles - Take 2
item.description: So back in 2013 I posted a little function I wrote for grabbing all the relevant files that make up a shapefile from a URL. Turns out it doesn’t play so well with Windows 7 or Windows 8 (HT: John Lewis). Below is a reprised version that at least works on Ubuntu 14.04 and Windows 7. Haven’t tested it beyond that and supressing the warnings to get httr::GET to not complain too much about FTP seems a bit unclean.
